title: Mourning the death of Wilbur "Bill" Barkman, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death  of Wilbur "Bill" Barkman,
distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Wilbur "Bill" Barkman of Johnson  City,  New  York,  died  on
Monday, August 23, 2010, at the age of 81; and
  WHEREAS,  Bill  Barkman distinguished himself in his profession and by
his sincere dedication and substantial contribution to  the  welfare  of
his community; and
  WHEREAS,  Retired  from Johnson City School District in 1991, he was a
Junior Varsity Coach for Johnson City High and a Little League Coach and
Manager for over 50 years; and
  WHEREAS, For his and his brothers' long contribution  to  the  Johnson
City  Little  League,  the current All Star Tournament is in their name;
and
  WHEREAS, In addition to his work with Johnson City Little League, Bill
Barkman worked for 27 years as a groundskeeper with  Johnson  City  High
School, preparing the varsity baseball and football fields before retir-
ing in 1994; he and his brother also worked the chains at Wildcats foot-
ball games; and
  WHEREAS,  Bill  Barkman's  commitment to excellence, and his spirit of
humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including charita-
ble and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, A family man who loved family gatherings, Bill Barkman was  a
congregant of All Saints Episcopal Church in Johnson City, New York; and
  WHEREAS,  Although  he  was  an  avid bowler and a fan of football and
basketball, his true passion was baseball, particularly youth  baseball;
and
  WHEREAS,  Predeceased by his parents, Ralph and Martha Barkman; infant
daughter, Susan Barkman; and sister, Wilma  Bartlett,  Bill  Barkman  is
survived  by  his  loving  wife  of  60  years, Thelma Barkman; sons and
daughter-in-law, David and Linda Barkman, William Barkman,  Larry  Bark-
man;  brothers, Elmer and Terry Barkman; and grandchildren, Gary (Mindy)
Barkman, Kenny Barkman and  Stephanie  Marrotta,  Vince  Barkman,  Katie
Merrill, David Barkman; as well as several great-grandchildren; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, Bill Barkman leaves behind
a legacy which will long endure the passage of time and will remain as a
comforting memory to all he served and befriended; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
mourn  the  death  of  Wilbur  "Bill" Barkman, distinguished citizen and
devoted member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Wilbur "Bill" Barkman.
